title: Don't worry about China's big banks
text:
Western prophets of Chinese financial collapse have cried wolf so regularly their throats must be sore. A $US28 billion ($41.5 billion) cash injection by the central bank is the latest shadow amid the trees to scare them.

Do not be surprised if the threat is just another trick of light. China’s big banks are well positioned.

Fresh liquidity from the People’s Bank of China will help support regional banks and small companies. It turned on the taps just a couple of days before the release of quarterly gross domestic product data. These are expected to show a slowdown to below 6.1 per cent, the slowest growth in almost three decades.

That sounds worrying, just like those travellers’ tales of endless empty new-build apartments. The same would apply to corporate bond defaults, which are headed for a record year.

A positive spin on the news is more convincing. The PBoC evidently wants to cushion minor lenders from sudden shocks. Defaults are mostly on loans regional banks made to smaller companies.

Big banks have taken a more conservative stance. This has limited their exposure while raising financing costs for weaker companies.
description: Western prophets of Chinese financial collapse have cried wolf so regularly their throats must be sore. Stop listening to them.
